paper_citation: Da'ar OB, Kalmey F, The level of countries' preparedness to health risks during Covid-19 and pre-pandemic: the differential response to health systems building blocks and socioeconomic indicators, Health Economics Review, 2023, 13:16, https://doi.org/10.1186/s13561-023-00428-9
regions_compared: Yes, compares preparedness across WHO regions and income levels
geographic_factors: Geographic location, regional differences across WHO regions (Africa, Americas, Eastern Mediterranean, European, Southeast Asia, West Pacific)
institutional_factors: Governance effectiveness, health financing systems, public health policies, international health regulations compliance
infrastructural_factors: Supply chain capacity for medicines and technologies, communication infrastructure, health workforce (doctors and nurses per 1000 population), hospital beds per 1000 population, health service delivery systems
other_resilience_factors: Human Development Index (HDI), Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) achievement, income levels
evidence_strength: Medium, uses Global Health Security Index data with statistical analysis but acknowledges limitations in index's predictive ability
evidence_gaps: Lacks validation against actual pandemic outcomes; GHS Index criticized for discrepancy between ratings and actual country performance
implemented_measures: Global Health Security Index framework for assessing country preparedness
proposed_measures: Strengthening health systems building blocks, enhancing supply chain capacity, improving health financing, boosting SDG achievement
main_resilience_factors: Effective governance, supply chain capacity, health financing, and communication infrastructure were most significant for enhancing regional resilience to pandemics
differential_effectiveness: Yes, effects of health system building blocks were considerably larger for countries with higher levels of preparedness
resilience_tradeoffs: Yes, high-income countries showed complacency in preparedness despite greater resources
vulnerable_resilient_regions: Africa identified as least prepared region; Southeast Asia, Europe, Americas, and West Pacific regions more prepared than Africa
key_quotes: \The results show that increases in effective governance
additional_notes: supply chain capacity in terms of medicines and technologies
